name: ServiceTaxonomyEditor
description: Sets up the Service Taxonomy Editor
author: National Careers Service

HtmlBodyPartTrumbowygEditorSettings.Options:
{
    semantic: {
        'b': 'strong',
        'i': 'em',
        's': 'del',
        'strike': 'del',
        'div': 'div'
    },
    tagsToKeep: [
      "area",
      "base",
      "br",
      "col",
      "embed",
      "hr",
      "img",
      "input",
      "param",
      "source",
      "track",
      "wbr",

      "div",
      "iframe",
      "form"
    ],
    autogrow: true,
    btns: [
        ["viewHTML"],
        ["undo", "redo"],
        ["heading", "paragraph", "fontSize"],
        ["fontWeight"],
        ["foreColor", "backColor"],
        ["links"],
        ["image"],
        ["align"],
        ["list", "bulletList", "numberList"],
        ["sectionBreak"],
        ["removeformat"],
        ["fullscreen"],
        ["accordion"],
        ["tabs"]
    ],
    btnsDef: {
        align: {
            dropdown: ["justifyLeft", "justifyCenter", "justifyRight", "justifyFull"],
            ico: "justifyLeft"
        },
        image: {
            dropdown: ["insertMedia", "base64","youtubeLink"],
            ico: "insertImage"
        }
    },
    plugins: {
      colors: {
          colorList: [
            '0b0c0c',
            '626a6e',
            '1d70b8',
            '003078',
            '4c2c92',
            'b1b4b6',
            'ffdd00',
            'd4351c',
            
            '003a69',
            '347ca9',
            
            '00703c',
            '5694ca',
            'f3f2f1',
            'ffffff',
            '6f72af',
            '912b88',
            'd53880',
            'f499be',
            'f47738',
            'b58840',
            '85994b',
            '28a197',
          ]
      }
  }
}

ContentPartSettings.Description: Provides an editor for the common properties of a content item.
Provides a Liquid formatted body for your content item.
Provides a way to define custom aliases for content items.
Provides a custom url for your content item.
Provides a way to add widgets per content items.
Provides a customizable body for your content item.
Provides a collection behavior for your content item.
Provides an HTML Body for your content item.
Provides a Markdown formatted body for your content item.
Provides a Title for your content item.
Provides a menu link behavior for your content item.

ContentPartSettings.Description: Enables the content type to be synced to a graph.
Lookup node(s) from the graph and create relationships and/or set a property based on the selection.
Provides a way to define the url that is used to render your content item.

BooleanFieldSettings.Hint: Switch on to make banner 'global'. If this is left switched off. PageBanner content items will need to be created where each banner can be manually added to individual pages or sections of the website.

A banner will not display until it is set to active.
Also use to easily hide banners when they are no loger required.

TextFieldSettings.Hint: Enter the name of the individual webpage or the parent webpage/section you are adding a banner to.

ContentPartFieldSettings.DisplayName: Enter a webpage location to display the banner(s)

TextFieldSettings.Hint: Copy and paste the National Careers Service website URL to define where to display the banners.To display banners across a whole section such as ‘Careers advice’, enter the parent location URL for this section,e.g. nationalcareers.service.gov.uk/careers-advice. The banners will appear on every page within /careers-advice.Displaying or managing banners on a individual page is possible, but only if there are no further child pages nested within the location specified,e.g. nationalcareers.service.gov.uk/careers-advice/advice-on-a-gap-year.

ContentPickerFieldSettings.Hint: Drag and drop banners to arrange the order in which they will display on the webpage location(s) defined above. Remove individual banners as necessary. Global banners cannot be manually ordered or removed.
